timeline.headline: Han Ngo
timeline.text:
Founder @ Dwarves Foundation
Founder @ delivr.to

It's the timeline of memorable and important events of my life, visualized in a way my mind always imagine it.

date.headline: Meet Minh Trang
date.text: She is the love one and my high school classmate. We escape successfully from friendzone and become sweet hearts for long periods of time.

date.headline: My first mobile device - BB 7730
date.text: Earning money for 6 months and buying my first mobile phone BlackBerry 7730 from a local retailer. Fall in love with BlackBerry at the first sight. Unfortunately, I lost it after 8 months.

asset.caption: The last picture of him taken by myself

date.headline: Student of HCMC University of Science
date.text: HCMC University of Science is one of the most popular city in Vietnam. I joined the Honour Program which has a special courses for Computer Science major. Have a lot of fun here.

asset.caption: My classmates and Head Teacher, Dr. Minh-Triet Tran

date.headline: Intern at eSilicon
date.text: Receive Internship Scholarship from eSilicon VN (former SDS). My supervisor, Duc Nguyen, teaches me a lot of things. This is also the first time I play with Linux and Perl, a powerful language in processing text.

date.headline: .NET Developer at HPT Vietnam
date.text:
Member of team Workflow. We built a core platform in .NET for project eSuccess, a more advanced ERP for Vietnam company.
I have a chance to work with Quoc Anh.

date.headline: 1st prize Blackberry Jam Hack VN 2012 | [Lifebox 365]
date.text:
We formed a team named Lifebox included me, Quoc Anh, Khai Le and Hong Le, which is friends of Quoc Anh, to took participate in BlackBerry Jam Hack.

We built Lifebox 365, an mobile app to captured memorable moments that you review back all these, learn a lot from the past and even get inspired to do better for your goals. We won a chance to go to Thailand.

date.headline: Runner Up in Blackberry Jam Asia 2012 | [Lifebox 365]
date.text: We bring Lifebox 365 to Thailand to compete with other teams in Asia. Thanks to our hard work and the encourage of BlackBerry Vietnam team, we won the Runner Up.

date.headline: Join Lifebox JSC as a Hacker
date.text:
After dropping out Lifebox 365, we moved forward to establish Lifebox JSC, make Lifebox Daily, an productivity email system and web based application for daily report and digest.

We was inspired by done list theory and iDoneThis. We built it on Django, mail service provided from Sendgrid and run on Heroku platform. I also met Vu Le and Khoa Tu then.

Unfortunately, we cannot find a market in Vietnam and it has been shut down after 8 months.

asset.caption: One of the most hilarious memories

date.headline: Organize TechTuesday
date.text:
For the sake of startup community, we help Anh Minh from TechInAsia organize event TechTuesday every 2 weeks in Ho Chi Minh. Same time, same place and no speakers.

But this event cannot last long because all the team members have to move to Singapore for the new journey. Trung joined the team at this time.

date.headline: Lifebox Realtime and the migration to CloudJay
date.text: After Lifebox Daily and with the insight of Trung, Lifebox Realtime had came. It is a field report app on the mobile that help manager can be updated realtime information from the field, just pictures and realtime information. We target on logistics and construction major.

date.headline: Join class 2013B at JFDI
date.text:
With Lifebox Realtime, we applied to JFDI Accelerate Program and got a seed fund about 25k Singapore Dollars. So we moved to Singapore and found CloudJay Pte. Ltd. that aim be a startup providing fast and clean cloud computing solutions for logistics industry.

We renamed Lifebox Realtime to JayPixApp

date.headline: Graduation, Bachelor degree
date.text: Graduated from Honour Program, HCMC University of Science, Bachelor degree, CS major. Just back from Singapore.

date.headline: CJay, A Container Network
date.text:
Failure streak is unstoppable. And as you guest, JayPixApp also failed from execution. People doesn't find it is necessary to pay for. And we do not have enough connections to push that app to the market. Then after 100 days at JFDI, we feel bad and get back to Vietnam.

With enthusiasm, we find new direction and work with Phuoc Long ICD to try new product, CJayNet, a realtime container network that push the flow of information faster, cut down the gap time between field and office, provide monitor dashboard for depot managers and operators.

date.headline: Recruit new members
date.text: As the team grow up, we need to boost up the progress of making new application. And I've find out 2 candidates: Nam & Thai. It costs me 6 months to transfer necessary knowledge of Android Development.

date.headline: VYE Bootcamp 2014
date.text: Thanks to CloudJay and esp. Trung recommendation, I am accepted and become a camper of VYE bootcamp 2014. I have met a lot of friends and have lots of memorable moments w/ them. I come to VYE with Gossip, an location based anonymous social network which was inspired by Yik Yak and Secret, provide a place that people can share their really thoughts without caring about other criticism.

date.headline: Upgrade CJay to next version
date.text: We need to upgrade CJay app so that it can handle large data set in local disc, support working under the rain, faster than the old one. CJay v2 also has the contributions of Thai and Nam.

date.headline: First prize winner at DevFest Challenge
date.text: DevFest is an event held by Google Developer Group and Silicon Strait Saigon. There are about 20 teams. They give some tips and we have to find out the way to turn on the 3 lights via rest api. We won luckily.

date.headline: Sharing a topic at Barcamp Saigon
date.text: Join Barcamp Saigon 2014 and share a topic `How to handle large dataset in Android with SnappyDB. Slide can be found at this post

date.headline: Found Dwarves Foundation
date.text: Dwarves Foundation (DF) is a team in Saigon, Vietnam. We call ourselves dwarves, the small and misshapen creatures in Norse Mythology. We are wisdom, natural good at smithing, mining, and crafting. We provide Tech Partnership to venture and startup.

date.headline: Found Golang Vietnam
date.text: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software. Go is backed by Google. Golang Community has growth rate higher and higher after years. But there are not so much Gophers in Vietnam. For the sake of community, I found Golang Vietnam group, start with Meetup series.

asset.caption: First Golang Vietnam meetup with 50 attendees

date.headline: Start `Today I learned` repo
date.text: Everyday life, the knowledge bypass my brain and go thru. I use Github Issues to organize them. Read more about it at: http://tieubao.me/writing/2015/12/03/today-i-learned/

date.headline: Finished first 4 projects of Dwarves Foundation
date.text: After working hard for a long time, we had finished 4 projects for our customers, including Pear Comms, Sales In One and one Vietnam client. For retrospective, we knew that we need to learn more in term of professional service and engineering knowledge.

date.headline: Found delivr.to, p2p delivery network
date.text: delivr.to is the invite only & peer to peer delivery platform connects shoppers with travellers to help you buy and deliver anything around the world.

date.headline: First Pull Request
date.text: As I started learning Elixir as resolution for 2016, I make _mix, a zsh (prezto) script/plugin that provide completion for elixir mix tool.

date.headline: TOPICA award in Edtech Asia Hackathon
date.text:
The team of 4 lead engineers from separate companies gathers and fly down to Hanoi, Vietnam. We joined Topica Asia Hackathon with VirtualBook, which is an open platform where people can contribute/submit their knowledge as lectures/slides in supported 3D VR models and others can use them for educational purposes.

More info: http://devpost.com/software/virtualbook

asset.caption: The picture of all the winners

date.headline: Vim+Go sharing at Innovatube Tech Talk #3
date.text: I was invited to give a talk about how to use Vim as Go IDE. The talk went through basic of Vim and the real life workflow of using vim-go plugin.

asset.caption: The picture of all the winners

date.headline: FRP sharing at Mobile Day Vietnam 2016
date.text:
Mobile Day 2016 is one of the biggest annually Tech event in Vietnam and I feel good to be invited as the guest speaker about Mobile Technology.

Slidedeck at: https://speakerdeck.com/tieubao/functional-reactive-programming-in-mobile-development
